name: Ofloxacin
indications: ofloxacin ophthalmic solution indicated treatment infections caused susceptible strains following bacteria conditions listed : conjunctivitis : gram - positive bacteria : gram - negative bacteria : staphylococcus aureus enterobacter cloacae staphylococcus epidermidis haemophilus influenzae streptococcus pneumoniae proteus mirabilis pseudomonas aeruginosa corneal ulcers : gram - positive bacteria : gram - negative bacteria : staphylococcus aureus pseudomonas aeruginosa staphylococcus epidermidis serratia marcescens * streptococcus pneumoniae anaerobic species : propionibacterium acnes * efficacy organism studied fewer 10 infections
contraindications: recommended regimen treatment bacterial conjunctivitisis : days 1 2 instill one two drops every two four hours affected eye ( ) . days 3 7 instill one two drops four times daily . recommended regimen treatment bacterial corneal ulcer : days 1 2 instill one two drops affected eye every 30 minutes , awake . awaken approximately four six hours retiring instill one two drops . days 3 7 9 instill one two drops hourly , awake . days 7 9 throughtreatment completion instill one two drops , four times daily .
warningsAndPrecautions: ofloxacin ophthalmic solution 0.3 % supplied sterile labeled translucent ldpe bottle insert cap assembly comprising tan colored hdpe screw cap ldpe nozzle tamper-evident ldpe dust cover sealing bottle cap . ndc : 70518-2037-00 packaging : 5 1 carton , 5 ml 1 bottle plastic type 0 note : store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . rx repackaged distributed : remedy repack , inc. 625 kolter dr. suite # 4 indiana , pa 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions: ofloxacin ophthalmic solution contraindicated patients history hypersensitivity ofloxacin , quinolones , components medication ( ) .
indications_original:
Ofloxacin ophthalmic solution is indicated for the treatment of infections caused by susceptible strains of the following bacteria in the conditions listed below:
                  
                     
                     
                     
                        
                           
                              CONJUNCTIVITIS

contraindications_original:
The recommended dosage regimen for the treatment of
 
  bacterial conjunctivitisis:

 
                  
                     
                     
                     
                        
                           Days 1 and 2 
     
                           
                           Instill one to two drops every two to four hours in the affected eye(s). 
     
                           
                        
                        
                           Days 3 through 7 
     
                           
                           Instill one to two drops four times daily. 
     
                           
                        
                        
                           The recommended dosage regimen for the treatment of 
    
     bacterial 
                              corneal 
                              ulcer is: 
     
                           
                        
                        
                           Days 1 and 2 
     
                           
                           Instill one to two drops into the affected eye every 30 minutes, while awake. Awaken at approximately four and six hours after retiring and instill one to two drops. 
     
                           
                        
                        
                           Days 3 through 7 to 9 
     
                           
                           Instill one to two drops hourly, while awake. 
     
                           
                        
                        
                           Days 7 to 9 throughtreatment completion 
     
                           
                           Instill one to two drops, four times daily.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Ofloxacin Ophthalmic Solution 0.3% is supplied sterile in a labeled translucent LDPE bottle with insert cap assembly comprising of tan colored HDPE screw cap over a LDPE nozzle with tamper-evident LDPE dust cover sealing the bottle cap.
                  
                  NDC: 70518-2037-00
                  PACKAGING: 5 in 1 CARTON, 5 mL in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC TYPE 0
                  
                  Note: Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F)[see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  Rx Only
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions_original: Ofloxacin Ophthalmic Solution is contraindicated in patients with a history of hypersensitivity to ofloxacin, to other quinolones, or to any of the components in this medication (see Warnings).
